Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy
1. Introduction
1. Introduction

Welcome and thank you for your interest in Wajooba LLC. (cool name, eh?) (referred to as “Wajooba”, and also as “our”, “us” and “we”). This Privacy Policy explains how information that identifies or is associated with you (your ”personal information”) is collected, used, and disclosed by Wajooba. This Privacy Policy applies to our websites including https://wajooba.com and any other website that links to this Policy (our ”Sites”) (collectively, our “Service”). Before accessing or using our Service, please ensure that you have read, and understood our collection, storage, use, and disclosure of your personal information as described in this Privacy Policy and our Terms And Conditions.
Why do we have a Privacy Policy? What is it for? Does anyone read it? All those answers will follow soon.
This Policy shall supplement our Terms and Conditions of Service (the “Terms”), along with any other guidelines and policies provided by us from time to time, all incorporated herein by reference.

Here at Wajooba, we work hard to earn and keep your trust; and therefore we adhere to the following principles in order to protect your privacy: We will not sell or lease your PI to third parties.We will not disclose your PI with other users or third parties without your consent.Any PI that you provide to Wajooba will be secured with industry standard safety protocols and technology.

As used herein and elsewhere, the words “collect”, “use”, “process”, “treat”, “disclose” and analogous shall be related to your PI and other data that we may receive from our clients, users and/or visitors, including cookies inside a computer and mobile device IDs.
2. Information Collected
2. Information Collected

You can rest assured that we will never spam your inbox, provide unsolicited offers or otherwise disclose your personally identifiable information (the “PI”) to any third party, unless we have your prior express consent.
Ok, so what is personally identifiable information? Is it a fancy way of referring to your email? Well, yes.

In order to use the Service, you may or will need to disclose PI to us, including but not limited to: your name, last name, IP address, email, phone number, gender, date of birth, address and postal/zip code. In addition, we offer certain payment functionalities, which require that certain third party payment processing platforms collect sensitive financial information of our users (e.g. credit card and payment information).

We know most people never read the legal of websites, and that perhaps only our main clients, investors, their attorneys and the most hardcore of our users will ever read them. In any case, it doesn’t hurt to read this, so please, we invite you to read this Policy carefully before providing any information to us.
3. Updates
3. Updates

We do not ask you to send or to disclose us, any kind of sensitive PI, that is, Social Security numbers, information related to racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religion or other beliefs, health, biometrics or genetic characteristics, trade union membership or criminal background.
No identity theft here. Continue reading.

If you do not wish to disclose any or part of your PI to us, you may still be able to use some of the functionalities of our Service, though we will not be able to guarantee that you will be able to enjoy our offerings and benefits if you elect not to disclose it to us. Overall, your final remedies will be to close this web tab, delete your account with us and/or exit the Service.
Please, do not use the Service if you do not agree with this Policy or any other rules of the Service. No kidding.
4. Purpose and Process of Collected Information
4. Purpose and Process of Collected Information

We process the information and PI we automatically collect in order to analyze trends, administer, monitor and improve our Service, and to gather for aggregated information to be used as basis for business strategies. We may use this data in aggregate form, that is, as a statistical measure in order to analyze and improve our Service. Such information cannot be used or disclosed in a manner that would identify a user personally. In summary, we will generally collect, use and disclose your PI to:
Why do we use funny words that even we have to search for in Wikipedia? Well, because our lawyers told us to, that is why.
Send recommendations about your browsing preferences.
Verify your e-mail address; send password retrieval links and other account notices.
Develop, research, process, safeguard and improve our Service.
Customize your advertising interactions, provide you with marketing affiliate opportunities and other benefits with our authorized third parties.
Answer to queries, service tickets and suggestions you submit to us.
Improve your user experience, offer newsletters, sweepstakes, contests and similar promotions, send service related announcements and contact you about inquiries for our Service.
In short, most if not all info you provide to us can and will be used to carry on our business.
5. Access to your Information
5. Access to your Information

We continuously try to improve our user experience, and to give you the best choices for providing, editing or removing certain personally identifiable information collected by us from you, as well as choice over how we contact you. Generally, you will be able to edit, select or delete the amount and type of information you provide to us when using our Service, usually in the settings section of your account. You may also contact us to request any additional changes to your personally identifiable information at support@wajooba.com
If you are absolutely against your email being in our databases, just send us … an email … so we can delete it from them.

Accordingly, we will undertake the open and transparent management of your PI and will: (i) inform you about how your personal information may be used and disclosed (including overseas); (ii) maintain the safety and integrity of your personal information; and/or (iii) enforce your individual right to access and correct your personal information.
6. Control of your information
6. Control of your information
We are surprised you are still reading this.

We continuously try to improve our user experience, and strive to provide you the best choices for the disclosure, edition or removal of the PI being processed by us. In order to enforce of your privacy rights, please contact us as indicated in our Service. Your privacy request must include, at the least, the following information: (i) your complete name, address and/or e-mail address in order for us to notify you the response to your request; (ii) attached documents establishing your identity; and (iii) a clear and concise description of the PI with regard to which you seek to enforce any of your privacy rights. If you request rectification, please indicate amendments to be made and attach documentation to back up your request.

Upon receipt of your privacy request, and after due review, we may then edit, deactivate and/or delete your PI from our databases. We will retain your PI for as long as needed to provide the applicable Service you use, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law. In case of secure databases under our control where deletion becomes impossible, we will make such information inaccessible. Please take into account that we may not be able to delete all of your data from our secure databases or the databases of third parties to which your PI has already been disclosed. If that is the case, please contact such third parties directly in order to request enforcement of your privacy rights.
7. Safety of your information
7. Safety of your information

We use industry standard protocols and technology to protect your registered user information and PI, such as Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology and secure databases. Your PI is only accessible by a limited number of our employees who have special access rights. Overall, we implement and maintain reasonable security measures to protect our databases and records from unauthorized access, acquisition, destruction, use, modification or disclosure. However, please take into account that the Internet and related transmissions are not secure or error free communication means.
We did pay for the expensive Security Testing services and anti-hacker plug-ins you know!

Additionally, if you post information on a public forum, message board, blog or bulletin board, any PI you elect to disclose therein there may or will be read, collected and/or used by other users of such forums and could be used by third parties to send you unsolicited messages.
Please do not blame us for your Facebook comments or likes. Or if your ex stalks you there.
8. Information Release and Disclosure
8. Information Release and Disclosure

We must reserve our right to disclose your PI when we or our affiliates, clients, contractors, licensors, officers, agents and/or representatives reasonably believe it necessary to protect our interests, or where you result to be in breach of Terms and/or this Policy. Accordingly, we will have the right to disclose any and all collected PI and/or data, under the following circumstances:

This is a lot of legal mambo jumbo. It basically says: if you don’t want your info used by us, then don’t use the service. This is the third or fourth time we have told you so, but what to do about, lawyers.
If required under applicable law, rules or regulations.
In response to a valid request or subpoena from a government or law enforcement agency.
To defend ourselves and our affiliates, licensors, officers, agents and representatives from legal claims and processes brought to us by third parties (including takedown notices).
9. Payment Processors
9. Payment Processors
To defend the property, rights and integrity of any of our users, advertisers or licensors.
To stop or cause to cease any actions that we may consider to cause -whether allegedly or factually- a contingency or liability.

We may also share non-personally identifying information with our authorized third party service providers, such as: aggregate user statistics, demographic information and web site usage information. Our service providers do not have any right to use your PI or other information we share with them beyond what is necessary to assist us in order to provide the products or Service requested by you. Our service providers and business partners are bound to the same standards of safety and privacy that we have promised to you in this Policy.
10. Taxes
10. Taxes

Upon the case where our business is or becomes part of any merger, acquisition, financing or similar transaction, or in the event of insolvency or bankruptcy, your PI may be disclosed and otherwise transferred to such entities. Simple use of our Service entails your acknowledgement and authorization to such information transfer, if any.

Our users who are healthcare professionals, their employees and their agents are bound to additional obligations of patient confidentiality under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (“HIPAA”). Wajooba is not bound under compliance with the HIPAA, and henceforth we do not have, will not accept, and expressly renounce and waive, any and all obligations of confidentiality with respect to any communications other than those expressly stated in this Policy and our Terms.
11. Parental Notice
11. Parental Notice

Through the simple use of the our Service, you represent and warrant that you are at least eighteen (18) years of age –or older– as of the date of first access thereof. If you are still a minor (which may depend on the jurisdiction where you reside), you cannot use our Service, even under the direct supervision of your parent or legal guardian.
We are in favor of the safe Internet use by all. So please watch out for your children. Do not blame us if they use Tinder.

Wajooba does not knowingly collect any kind of information from persons under the age of thirteen (13). If we learn or have reason to suspect that a user is under such age, we will delete any PI under that user’s account.
12. Newsletters and Commercial Messages
12. Newsletters and Commercial Messages

From time to time, we will ask you for express permission and consent to receive Commercial Electronic Messages (‘CEM’). A CEM is a message in an electronic format (e.g. email, SMS, push notifications and other form of communications) which is then sent to an electronic address (e.g. email, mobile device) and that contains a message asking recipients to participate in commercial activities (e.g. purchase of products, Service and invitations to participate in user research).

Our optional email newsletters are considered CEMs, and therefore you may subscribe or unsubscribe from them at will, usually on your account settings, or by following the unsubscribe links contained therein. You may opt-out at any time you want, which will allow you to save your information with us, while we will not be able use your information for marketing purposes.
13. Cookies and Bacon
13. Cookies and Bacon

In order to run our business, we may place the so-called ‘cookies’ in your computer in order to track and collect data regarding your use of our Service. Cookies are small text files that our Service transfers to you and that allow us permit us to recognize you and obtain data such as how, when and how long you browse pages in our Service. We also use the so-called ‘beacons’, which are small files, sometimes only a pixel in size, embedded onto the pages of our Service. Beacons are used to identify each of our pages in order to be analyzed by our system tools.

The cookies we talk to are not cookies for children, or chocolate cookies, but rather a silly term coined by nerds back in the 90s to describe small text files that websites place in your browser when you visit them.

When you access our Service via a mobile device, we will use your mobile device ID (i.e. the unique identifier assigned to a mobile device by the manufacturer) and/or Advertising ID (for Apple iOS 6 and later) instead of cookies in order to recognize you, track the number of relevant ads displayed, their performance and display.

We may also collect and use the data contained in log files, which may include your IP (internet protocol) address, your ISP (internet service provider), the browser you used to visit our Service, the time you visited our Service and which pages you visited throughout our Service.
Our cookies are flavor free, and do not collect personally identifiable information from you.

You can always configure your browser to refuse cookies and beacons. For more information, please visit www.allaboutcookies.com. Unlike cookies, device IDs cannot be deleted, but you can select to reset your Advertising IDs in the “Settings” section of your mobile device, among other settings.
If you do not agree to this use of cookies, please disable them. Or eat them. Actually, we are surprised no one has coined a better term than ‘cookies’ by now.
14. Third party Services
14. Third party Services

our Service may display hyperlinks to the websites of our commercial partners and other third parties. If you click on such links, you are choosing to visit such websites, and will be redirected there. Please take into consideration that we are not responsible for the privacy and personal data practices undertook by such third parties (including any tools, cookies, information or content contained thereunto), and that we do not have control over the manner in which such third-parties may collect, process, treat or use your PI.

You can’t really blame us if some company selling you $10 plane tickets to Thailand floods your emails with offers, even if you got there from one of the many links inside our Service. As always, exit at your own risk!

When you use such links to go to another website, our Policy and Terms are no longer into effect and your browsing thereof is in your own and final risk. In addition, any banner or ad that we may have on our Service does not constitute any endorsement of any third party thereof.
It is so easy to read like this, isn’t it?
15. Advertising, Opt-Out
15. Advertising, Opt-Out

From time to time, we may use Google Analytics, Ad Words, Double Click and/or Ad Sense tracking codes, and other third party software tools (such as remarketing codes) in order to collect information and marketing analytics about the manner in which you browse our Service. These ads served will be targeted based on your previous browsing history, and may include retargeting codes. For example, third party vendors may show you Wajooba’s ads on certain websites across the Internet, even after you leave our Service. The collected information is anonymized, meaning it cannot be tracked back to individuals. Using such tools, we learn how to optimize, and serve ads based on a user’s past visits, providing you with a better user experience.

Why should you care about this? Why would you have any questions about an advertisement or other targeted content? Well, you have a right to privacy dude, and if you are not interested, or you didn’t know, well then you know that we DO care. If in doubt, please contact the responsible provider directly, or quit using the Internet altogether, or learn how to brose the deep web so you don’t get tracked by anyone. Except the NSA, who, you know, reads all emails and data sent over the web. NSA =bad guys. Wajooba = nice guys.

Our third party vendors may also use cookies and beacons to track your Internet browsing in order to serve you ads based on what they or us believe to be of interest according to your browsing activities and consumer preferences. Henceforth, by using this Service, you consent to such disclosure, treatment and storage of PI.

In order to enforce and uphold your right to privacy, you have the option to elect not to receive this type of advertising from us or third parties, now or in the future. You can learn more about how to opt-out by browsing Google’s opting-out and privacy pages located at www.google.com, or the Network Advertising Initiative website located at www.networkadvertising.org. In addition, you may set browser, mobile device and computer system preferences for how other third parties serve ads to you.
16. Payment Processors
16. Payment Processors

We use third-party payment processors to manage any transactions undertook through the Service. The processing of payments will be subject to the fees, terms, conditions and privacy policies of such payment processors. Wajooba is not responsible for any and all errors by the payment processors.
17. Social Media
17. Social Media

Our Service may offer the functionality of using your social media and other third party credentials (e.g. Facebook and Google) to execute single-sign-on, and in that manner we will also collect your PI as provided to us by such third party platforms; such as your photos, info of your social media contacts and their common contacts, login data and profile information such as “about me”, “friend lists” and “interests”. We will not collect more information when using such credentials beyond the PI such third parties generally disclose to us via their Services. For more information, please refer to the terms and policies of such platforms.
Facebook makes its money by making you work for free for them. No kidding.In 10 years, they should have algorithms that can replace you entirely. Like a Terminator based off on you.
18. International Disclosure
18. International Disclosure

Upon the case where Wajooba specifically undertakes the process of personal data that has been duly disclosed by you to us, and that is subject to national legislation that implements the EU Data Protection Directive (95/46/EC); you hereby acknowledge, agree and accept to such transfer by clicking the “I Accept” button or otherwise accepting the terms and conditions of our Service.

If you are accessing our Service from jurisdictions other than those that apply to Wajooba’s headquarters, please be advised that you are transferring your PI information to any country or jurisdiction in which Wajooba operates its facilities, which may have data protection laws that differ in scope to those in your jurisdiction and, thus, you hereby consent to such transfer of information.
19. Notice to California Residents
19. Notice to California Residents

In compliance with the California Civil Code Section 1798.83, residents of California are hereby notified that the Service and the appertaining PI are safeguarded by Wajooba LLC. Users can obtain certain information about the PI we may have access to, including disclosure thereof with third parties for direct marketing purposes (e.g. names and addresses of those third parties, types of services or products marketed thereby). If you wish to request a copy of your information disclosure, please contact us as indicated below.
Go Cali! We protect and care for our California customers.
20. California Online Privacy Protection Act
20. California Online Privacy Protection Act

In compliance with CalOPPA, we have hereby posted this conspicuous Policy to the public, indicating the PI being collected and the manner in which it may be disclosed and with whom. Accordingly, our users can may visit our Service using anonymous browsing, this Policy linked in our home page, with the link including the word ‘Privacy’ or similar. We also comply with Policy changes notification to our users, and provide mechanisms that allow our users to manage their PI personal information.

Such notification will be subject to a variety of factors, including but not limited to, the type of PI breached, whether the database was secured or not, type of key/cipher used, whether the PI was factually or allegedly acquired by an unauthorized person, and whether misuse of the PI is reasonably possible. Our customers can rest assured that we will undertake any and all necessary safety, managerial and technical measures in order to protect your PI and our right to privacy.
If we could put your personal info in a safe box, we would do it, but since the Internet is a public (read: sometimes unsafe) network, we will try our best to protect it.
21. Amendments, Updates
21. Amendments, Updates

We reserve the right to amend, change, suspend and/or update our Service, this Policy and/or our Terms, in whole or in part, from time to time and at our sole and final discretion. Your continued use thereof after the last effective date of modifications thereof indicates your acceptance of such modifications. We will post any updates on our Service, and may also send you an email or otherwise notify you of any material changes to this Policy.
We can change the menu when we want it. Of course we do. Why? Because it is our Service silly.
22. Contact
22. Contact
If you have any questions or queries about us, our Service, our Terms and/or this Policy, please contact us at
support@wajooba.com
support@wajooba.com
and also at 6950 RockingHorse Lane, Cumming GA 30040.
